Culture.name: {=empirefaction}Empire
Culture.text: {=X0kKBzsW}The Calradians are the people of the Empire, though by now they have given their name to the entire continent which they dominate. A thousand years ago, they were an undistinguished tribe living in the hill country between the southern sea and the Battanian woods. One tradition set them apart from their neighbors - the Calradoi had no kings. Their citizenry has always taken an intense interest in the art of self-government, the balance between protecting the liberty of individuals and the needs of the state. Perhaps this is why they had a slight edge in the endless wars between one town and another, keeping armies in the field just a little longer, bouncing back just a little more quickly from a defeat. Some of their neighbors federated with them; others were overrun. Eventually the Calradians formed an empire, which evolved into a monarchy in all but name. Their leaders are no longer distinguished civic elders but great landholders scattered across the continent; the striking force of their armies is no longer citizen-infantry but heavily armored cataphracts in the retinues of the wealthy. But they still take their civic traditions very seriously, believing that the Calradian ideal can unite a continent in peace, if only the ”barbarians” beyond their borders would agree to submit to it.

Culture.name: {=aseraifaction}Galadhrim of Lothlórien
Culture.text: {=a2AjI8nc}The Lothlórien Elves are the guardians of the Golden Wood, a mystical forest nestled on the eastern side of the Misty Mountains. To outsiders, it may appear as an enchanted land, filled with towering mallorn trees whose golden leaves whisper ancient secrets. Hidden pathways wind through the dense woods, and the magic of the Lady Galadriel cloaks the realm, keeping it safe from unfriendly eyes. The Elves of Lothlórien are a proud and united people, bound by deep heritage and an unwavering devotion to protect their homeland. Though divided into different kin-groups, they all serve under the guidance of the wise Lord Celeborn and Lady Galadriel, standing as a shield against the encroaching darkness. Their strength lies in their skill with bow and blade, their connection to the forest, and their fierce determination to preserve the beauty of Lórien.

Culture.name: {=PjO7oY16}Dwarves of Erebor
Culture.text: {=Ud1AMybr}The Dwarves of Erebor, also known as the Kingdom Under the Mountain, dwell in the heart of the Lonely Mountain. For generations, Erebor stood as a beacon of Dwarven craftsmanship and wealth, renowned for its vast treasures of gold, precious gems, and the legendary Arkenstone. Despite enduring hardships, including the attack by Smaug the Dragon, the Dwarves have rebuilt their home into a thriving stronghold. Their society is rich in tradition and is driven by their skill in mining, metalwork, and stonecraft. Led by the King Under the Mountain, the Dwarves of Erebor are fiercely proud and protective of their realm, driven by their love of craft and the desire to maintain their autonomy. While typically more reserved and insular, they are no strangers to war and are always prepared to defend their halls against any threat, combining business with battle to safeguard their future.

Culture.name: {=FjwRsf1C}Rohirrim
Culture.text: {=1Ww5lg6I}Rohan, the land of the Rohirrim, is a vast and open realm of rolling plains and grassy hills, home to a proud people who are unmatched in their skill with horses. Founded by Eorl the Young, Rohan stands as the steadfast ally of Gondor, ever watchful against the encroaching threats from the east and south. The Rohirrim live a simple, honorable life, dedicated to their families, their king, and their horses, which they cherish as noble companions. In Rohan, valor and loyalty are the highest virtues, and every able man is trained as a rider, prepared to answer the call of the king in defense of their homeland. Known as fierce warriors and master horsemen, the Riders of Rohan stand ready to defend their fields and families from any threat, and their stronghold at Edoras is a beacon of strength and resilience against the darkness looming over Middle-earth.

Culture.name: {=0B27RrYJ}Silvan Elves of Mirkwood
Culture.text: {=Ax9OkgL5}Mirkwood, also known as the Woodland Realm, is an ancient and sprawling forest located in northern Middle-earth. Ruled by King Thranduil, the Silvan Elves of Mirkwood are guardians of the dark woods, ensuring that their land remains free from the encroaching shadow. Though the forest is dense and filled with both beauty and peril, the Elves thrive in its heart, using their unmatched skills in archery, stealth, and woodland warfare. They are adept at sudden strikes, night raids, and ambushes, using the deep, enchanted forest to their advantage. Fiercely independent, the Elves of Mirkwood are wary of outsiders, but those who respect their forest and their ways may find allies who are as loyal as they are formidable. The Woodland Realm remains a bastion of nature and magic, its people living in harmony with the forest while fiercely protecting their realm from any who dare threaten its tranquility.

Culture.name: {=sZLd6VHi}Easterlings
Culture.text: {=v5bWtXj1}Rhûn, the vast and mysterious land to the east of Middle-earth, is home to the fierce and warlike Easterlings. The tribes of Rhun are a proud and diverse people, each with their own traditions and way of life, yet bound together by their loyalty to the Dark Lord. These tribes have forged a formidable reputation as skilled horsemen and warriors, renowned for their deadly raids and lightning-fast strikes. Their settlements are a mix of mobile camps and fortified strongholds, reflecting their dual heritage of both nomadic and settled ways. Despite their alignment with the forces of darkness, the tribes of Rhun remain fiercely independent, with a strong sense of identity rooted in their ancient past and warrior culture. The Easterlings' loyalty to Sauron and their desire for expansion make them a constant threat to the Free Peoples of Middle-earth.

Culture.name: {=gondorfaction}Gondorian
Culture.text: {=X0kKBzsW}The Gondorians are the people of Gondor, a proud and ancient kingdom established in Middle-earth by the Númenóreans of old. Once a small colony among the hills near the Mouths of the Anduin, Gondor rose to greatness through the strength, wisdom, and valor of its people. From its gleaming white cities, Gondor extended its influence over much of the land, guided by a noble lineage that upheld justice and the defense of the free peoples. At its height, Gondor’s armies were feared and respected, with disciplined infantry, masterful archers, and heavy cavalry that guarded its borders from enemies who would threaten its peace. Unlike many realms that bowed to tyranny, Gondor has long maintained a tradition of stewardship, governance rooted in honor and duty, and a commitment to the ideals of justice and protection. But time has taken its toll. Gondor’s borders are besieged by darkness, its fortresses threatened by the forces of Mordor, and its armies wearied from constant conflict. Yet the spirit of Gondor endures. The people of this proud kingdom still hold firm to the ancient ideals and traditions that once made it a beacon of strength and hope. They believe that Gondor can still rise to unite the free peoples of Middle-earth, standing against the darkness that encroaches upon them all.

Culture.name: {=mordorfaction}Mordor
Culture.text: {=X0kKBzsX}The forces of Mordor are a dark and relentless power, forged in the shadow of Mount Doom and driven by the will of Sauron, the Dark Lord of Middle-earth. From the ash-laden wastelands and twisted fortresses, the armies of Mordor grow ever stronger, strengthened by fear, malice, and a hatred for the realms of Men and Elves. Unlike the kingdoms of light that cling to their crumbling ideals, Mordor endures with raw might and unwavering obedience to its master. Orc legions, tireless trolls, and twisted beasts of war stand ready to crush those who dare to oppose the Dark Lord's will. Discipline is replaced by bloodlust, honor by brutality, and where others see justice, Mordor sees only the inevitable rise of darkness. The land trembles beneath their march, their banners a signal of terror to all free peoples. In Mordor, hope is a weakness, and strength is measured by survival. Under Sauron's gaze, they prepare to sweep across Middle-earth, to lay waste to cities and claim dominion over all lands in the shadow of darkness.

Culture.name: {=rivendellfaction}Rivendell
Culture.text: {=X0kKBzsR}Rivendell, the hidden sanctuary nestled in the tranquil valleys of the Misty Mountains, stands as a beacon of wisdom and refuge for the Free Peoples of Middle-earth. Founded by Elrond Half-elven, Rivendell is a place of healing, knowledge, and counsel, where ancient lore and timeless beauty intertwine. Unlike the dark realms that seek dominion through brute force and fear, Rivendell endures through wisdom, peace, and resilience. Here, Elves train in the arts of archery and swordsmanship, defending their land with silent precision and skill. Songs of ages past fill the air, and its halls are graced by those who seek solace or guidance in these perilous times. Where other lands might falter under the growing shadow, Rivendell shines quietly, a steadfast reminder of all that is noble and beautiful. In this realm, hope is a strength, and endurance is found in unity and the preservation of ancient knowledge. Under Elrond’s watchful care, Rivendell stands against the darkness, a hidden jewel prepared to aid those who would oppose the encroaching shadow.
